poem:
**Rivers of Profit**

Under the watch of neglect,  
thin streams grow brown,  
the fiscal tide unfurls;  
Thames speaks not  
in murmurs of nature now,  
but in the stagnant whispers  
of commerce.  
Debts carve scars deep as silt,  
whilst rivers lose their clarity,  
reflecting only  
our collective indifference.
